column4: I tried e2retrieve, but all it does is spit out 3 files.  I can find no docs on what to do with those files.
fsck gives me errors on all the ones I've tried.
that's been my experience with alternate superblocks also, if one is bad they are all bad :=(
I could have said try an alternate superblock but that the only thing that I know to do. Maybe hit Google for ext3 or ext2 file corruption search. Sorry I am so dumb.
any think in the Lost and found directory?
none of the lost and found folders contain any data.
darn if I know maybe Google Lost and Found directory will give you some hint of where to go?
any other recovery tools you could suggest?
that doesn't surprise me.  I've been googling for most of the week, and asking in half a dozen irc channels.  No joy.

have you called any hard drive repair stores or services like a business supply outfit that maybe could put you on track. They have customers that have really valuable data that can't afford to be lost.
I have talked to a hard drive manufacturer when I had a disk fail under warranty and they have ways of recovery that probably cost you an arm and a leg but maybe they would at least talk to you free.
I looked at the back of a terminal on a screen at the Mayo Clinic and I saw a list of about 75 network addresses, ha!
